definition: acrobatic display (esp. on horseback) (old)/variant of 懈[xie4] and 邂[xie4] (old)
to divide/to break up/to split/to separate/to dissolve/to solve/to melt/to remove/to untie/to loosen/to open/to emancipate/to explain/to understand/to know/a solution/a dissection
to count/to count as/to regard as/to enumerate (sb's shortcomings)
to give it your all/to go at it with all you've got/to throw your whole weight behind it/also pr. [hun2 shen1 jie3 shu4]

sentences.english: This paper has investigated the system of congruences and given them the asymptotic formula of the number of solutions.
sentences.chinese: 给出了一类同余方程组解数的公式或渐近公式。

sentences.english: He is a cheeper apparently, I make him purposely happy, exert all over skill.
sentences.chinese: 他明显是个雏，我有心让他快乐，使出了浑身解数。

sentences.english: It was a wake-up call for Milan who began to take the game seriously and utilise all their assets.
sentences.chinese: 米兰方才如梦初醒，认真对待比赛，使出浑身解数。

sentences.english: A: Did you see him fall all over himself making excuses?
sentences.chinese: 看到他使出浑身解数为自己找借口了吗？

sentences.english: To figure out where disease-prevention dollars would be best spent, the scientists crunched the numbers.
sentences.chinese: 为了弄清楚疾病预防的支出，科学家们使尽浑身解数。

sentences.english: The actress emoted for all she was worth.
sentences.chinese: 女演员施展浑身解数来表演。

definition: to give it your all/to go at it with all you've got/to throw your whole weight behind it/also pr. [hun2 shen1 jie3 shu4]
to search one's guts and belly (idiom); to racks one's brains for a solution
to gather one's spirits/to pull oneself together
to dig for thoughts (idiom); to search everything for an answer/to rack one's brains

pinyin: jiu3 niu2 er4 hu3 zhi1 li4

definition: spirit weary, strength exhausted (idiom); spent/drained/washed out
use both carrot and stick/use gentle methods and force/an iron hand in a velvet glove
body weary, strength exhausted (idiom); extremely tired/spent
move (in chess, on stage, in martial arts)/gambit/trick/scheme/movement/same as 著數|着数[zhao1 shu4]
